creator: Clark, William, 1841-1902. (author)
description: Clark, William: 1841-1902. Miller in Scotland; to Canada, 1880; second editor of Nor'West Farmer, 1884; captain in the 90th Winnipeg Rifles in Saskatchewan Rebellion, and wounded at Fish Creek, April 24, 1885; member of Canadian rifle team at Wimbledon, 1885; represented Dominion government at Royal Colonial Exhibition, 1886; first grain inspector appointed by Dominion government at Winnipeg; later immigration official (Winnipeg Free Press, July 10, 1902; Nor'West Farmer, June 20, 1932; Morgan, Dominion Annual Register, 1885) // On cover: "Reprinted by permission from the Canadian Gazette ."
subject: Settling the West--Immigration Literature
Prairie Provinces--Description and travel
Prairie Provinces--Economic conditions
title: The Canadian North-West
